meanings.definition: A person who makes something obvious or clear.
meanings.sent1: The obviators in the group always point out the most important details.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was the obviator in the classroom, explaining complex concepts in simple terms.
meanings.sent3: The obviators at the party were the ones who kept reminding everyone of the time.
meanings.sent4: She was like an obviator, shining a spotlight on the key issues during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The obviators wore bright hats so they could be easily spotted in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To make something obvious or clear.
meanings.sent1: He obviators his point by using clear examples.
meanings.sent2: She obviators the instructions for the game so everyone can understand.
meanings.sent3: The magician obviators his tricks, but still manages to amaze the audience.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise obviators the beauty of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The detective obviators the hidden clues, solving the mystery in no time.

meanings.definition: The act of making something obvious or clear.
meanings.sent1: The obviators of the presentation were well-received by the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her obviators of the rules helped prevent any confusion.
meanings.sent3: The obviators of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The obviators of the storm approaching sent everyone scrambling for cover.
meanings.sent5: His obviators of the solution simplified the problem for everyone involved.
